West led an unfortunate , which declarer won in dummy. Declarer then finessed in diamonds, and ran diamonds. West had to find four pitches. The first three were two hearts and a club. But on the last diamond, West is stuck:
West cannot part with a spade, or the , so he must part with another club. Declarer can now lead a heart towards the jack, and East/West can only take two club tricks before conceding the rest.
Of course, this line fails when the spades were 3-3, but then West might pitch a spade. When West pitches the or , declarer might figure the hand out.
